creator: liste@psb.ugent.be
text:
I use Batik1.6 on a linux system to convert large svg files to png. Everything
works fine except when I specify the resolution for the png (the -dpi option)
then the fonts in my png file are enlarged relative to the resolution I give in.
Eg. when I want a resolution of 300 dpi the fonts are 3 times larger then when I
don't use the -dpi option (or the default 96) (600 dpi : 6 times larger, ...).
Can somebody help me?

creator: liste@psb.ugent.be
text:
Created attachment 18931
resulting png with enhanced fonts

Created attachment 18932
original svg file (correct font size), zipped
creator: liste@psb.ugent.be

text:
There are many ways to fix your content.
IMO the best way is to provide a viewBox
and then scale the output with the -width
or -height option.  You can also avoid
using any "real world" units other than
on the outermost width/height.
creator: deweese@apache.org
